events.title: World leaders to hold emergency summit on Greenland. And, SCOTUS weighs Fed case
events.summary: European leaders hold an emergency summit on a possible U.S.-Greenland deal. And, the Supreme Court weighs whether the president can fire Fed governors.

events.title: European leaders to meet for emergency summit about the U.S. and Greenland
events.summary: European leaders will gather in Brussels Thursday night for an emergency meeting on tensions with the U.S. over Greenland and President Trump's tariff threats.

events.title: Former U.S. ambassador discusses the path forward after Trump's Davos speech
events.summary: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Alan Leventhal, a former U.S. ambassador to Denmark, about developments following President Trump's speech in Davos.

events.title: Trump vs. U.S. allies: How will this end?
events.summary: The president has backed off his threat to take Greenland by force. But his highly inflammatory remarks in Switzerland rattled U.S. allies and threatened to tear down the pillars of the world order.

events.title: Iran blocked the internet amid deadly protests. Some voices are still getting through
events.summary: Weeks into an internet blackout in Iran, NPR speaks to a protester who is still online and a U.S.-based activist who is trying to get more Starlink terminals into the country to get more people online.

events.title: Trump's provocative rhetoric about Greenland threatens long-standing world order
events.summary: President Trump says he won't take Greenland by force, but he delivered provocative statements that have threatened to tear down the pillars of the world order constructed by the U.S. 80 years ago.

events.title: The U.S. is leaving the WHO. But like most breakups, the details are complicated
events.summary: The U.S.'s break from the World Health Organization is almost finalized. But the details of the breakup are complicated - as are the post-divorce dynamics.

events.title: Israeli fire strikes journalists and children in Gaza
events.summary: Israeli forces on Wednesday killed at least 11 Palestinians in Gaza, including two boys, three journalists and a woman, hospitals said, on one of the enclave 's deadliest days since the ceasefire took effect.

events.title: Some Britons wonder if the U.S. and U.K.'s 'special relationship' may end in divorce
events.summary: Some people in Britain are asking what it would look like for their government to sever security and intelligence ties with its closest ally, the U.S.

events.title: In Davos speech, Trump ruled out using military force to acquire Greenland
events.summary: During a speech in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump ruled out using military force to acquire Greenland. But he left many questions about the U.S. role in the world.

events.title: Where is the US-China AI 'race' heading in 2026?
events.summary: With American tech continuing to dominate developing the frontier of artificial intelligence, China is holding its own with globally popular cheaper models and plans for building an AI-powered economy in the near future.

events.title: From Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted American interest back in 1867.

events.title: Germany: far-right extremist 'Saxon Separatists' stand trial
events.summary: The trial of 8 suspected right-wing extremists accused of planning a coup is beginning in the German city of Dresden. Their goal: A Nazi state.

events.title: Germany expels Russian diplomat, summons ambassador over espionage case
events.summary: Germany has expelled an individual after uncovering espionage linked to Russia and summoned Moscow's ambassador. Berlin says the move signals zero tolerance for spying under diplomatic cover.

events.title: Davos: Germany's Merz says old world order 'unraveling'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the world has "entered an era of great power politics" where Russia and China challenge the US. In his speech at Davos, Merz said Europe must boost competitiveness and invest in defense.

events.title: Fact check: Trump's speech at the World Economic Forum
events.summary: At Davos, Trump made bold claims about Greenland, NATO spending and China’s wind power. DW Fact Check examines where his statements clash with historical records and current data.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: Hong Kong: Organizers of Tiananmen vigil put on trial
events.summary: Two of the defendants pleaded not guilty before the Hong Kong court, while the other pleaded guilty but pledged to keep working to end one-party rule in China. They're accused of "inciting subversion of state power."

events.title: Spain: Train collides with crane in wake of 2 deadly crashes
events.summary: Emergency crews are responding after a train collided with a construction crane in near Spain's Cartagena. The incident has added to growing scrutiny of rail safety after two serious accidents this week.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin mulls sending migrants to third nations
events.summary: Germany has joined a group of five nations to explore the deportations to third-country migrant hubs. Meanwhile, firefighters tackled a blaze at a property once belonging to prominent Nazi Joseph Goebbels. DW has more.

events.title: Donald Trump's latest visa ban hits African countries hard
events.summary: A decision by the US government to suspend visa procedures for numerous countries, including African ones, has come into effect. Experts say it is part of Donald Trump's strategy of portraying immigrants as a threat.

events.title: World Cup 2026: Could Europe drive a boycott?
events.summary: Just as it did in Russia 2018 and Qatar 2022, politics is dominating the build up to World Cup 2026. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights united behind such a cause?

events.title: Davos 2026: Trump lays out 'Board of Peace' plans
events.summary: The US president said that his new pay-to-play, invitation-only body would "work with the United Nations." Meanwhile, Chancellor Friedrich Merz said, "The old world order is unraveling at breathtaking pace." DW has more.

events.title: The business of saving nature
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Pakistan: Death toll soars in Karachi mall fire
events.summary: Rescuers have retrieved remains of many more victims from a gutted mall in Pakistan's Karachi, with dozens still missing. The cause of the disaster is still not known.

events.title: Elizabeth Holmes asks Trump to commute her prison sentence
events.summary: Elizabeth Holmes led people to believe that her now-defunct company, Theranos, had developed a medical device that could revolutionize blood tests. She is serving an 11-year sentence for fraud and conspiracy.

events.title: New Zealand: Campers missing after Mount Maunganui landslide
events.summary: A landslide has hit a busy campsite at New Zealand's Mount Maunganui, leaving several campers missing. Elsewhere, two people were killed when a house was hit by a separate landslide after two days of heavy rains.

events.title: Greenland: Trump signals deal, rolls back tariff threats
events.summary: US President Donald Trump calls announced framework for a deal on Greenland "complex" as details remain unclear. DW has the latest.

events.title: US begins transfer of IS fighters from Syria to Iraq
events.summary: The US thanked Iraq for its cooperation to transfer up to 7,000 prisoners out of Syria, after the Kurdish-led SDF lost control over the territory where the prisoner camps were held.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: Germany's rail service dealt major blow by government
events.summary: The government is reportedly walking back promises to fund major projects for national train operator Deutsche Bahn. DB is beset by chronic punctuality problems, decrepit infrastructure and a lack of investment.

events.title: Lumumba killing case back in Belgian courts, 65 years later
events.summary: Belgian ex-diplomat Etienne Davignon is defending himself in Brussels over his alleged role in the 1961 killing of Congolese leader Patrice Lumumba — a landmark case in Belgium's reckoning with its colonial past.

events.title: It's complicated: Macron's turbulent relationship with Trump
events.summary: More than any other head of state, French President Macron seems set on a collision course with Donald Trump. The Greenland crisis is a litmus test for his high-stakes mix of diplomacy and defiance.

events.title: New EU anti-racism strategy misses the point, say NGOs
events.summary: Diversity groups say the EU has weakened its newly-released policy to tackle discrimination. But was it due to fears of negative reactions from the Trump administration?

events.title: European Parliament votes to delay Mercosur deal in court
events.summary: Lawmakers voted narrowly to challenge the EU trade deal with Latin America in the bloc's top court, a move that could derail the deal. Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the deal should be provisionally enacted anyway.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Apple overtakes Samsung in phones sales worldwide
events.summary: After 14 years behind Samsung, Apple is back on top in global smartphone sales, just as Chinese rivals step up the pressure. Foldables and advanced AI are the new battleground in the fight for the next billion users.

events.title: Elon Musk mulls buying Ryanair amid spat with airline boss
events.summary: Elon Musk has asked his followers on X if he should buy Ryanair after a spat with the European budget airline's outspoken CEO Michael O'Leary.

events.title: Germany sees thousands join pro-Kurdish protests
events.summary: German cities saw large pro-Kurdish demonstrations on Tuesday as Syrian government troops clash with Kurdish forces in northeastern Syria.

events.title: Spain: Driver killed, passengers injured in new train crash
events.summary: A commuter train has crashed near Barcelona in northeastern Spain. The accident comes days after a deadly high-speed train collision in Andalusia killed 42.

events.title: 'We'll work something out,' Trump says of Greenland row
events.summary: While insisting the US needs control of Greenland, US President Trump was confident "something is going to happen that is going to be good for everybody" regarding tension between the US and Europe. Follow DW for more.

events.title: WEF in Davos: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.summary: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: Unrecognized pain: Most Halabja Massacre survivors have PTSD
events.summary: A new report finds ongoing trauma affects survivors of a 1988 chemical weapons attack on Kurdish Iraqis in Halabja and nearby communities, highlighting the need for better health and support services.

events.title: Why is Slovakia the EU's 'central hub' for VAT fraud?
events.summary: The EU's most senior prosecutor told Slovak MPs that one in three VAT fraud cases — involving the bloc's sales-tax system — has links to Slovakia. Why is the criminality concentrated there and is it a new problem?

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Iran's economic woes expose regime's tight grip
events.summary: As religious elites and Revolutionary Guards strengthen their hold on the economy, experts question how long the regime can survive.

events.title: African fans fume at 'disgraceful' World Cup travel ban
events.summary: Senegal's football team are champions of Africa, but fans from the country are banned from going to the US for the World Cup. They aren't the only ones, with Donald Trump's hostility and FIFA ticket prices hitting hard.

events.title: Ukraine: Overnight Russian attack cuts off power in Kyiv
events.summary: Russia pounded Ukraine's Kyiv region with combined drone and missile strikes overnight. Thousands of homes have been left without electricity and heating in freezing weather.

events.title: What is an exiled Iranian opposition group doing in Albania?
events.summary: Far from Tehran in a Balkan nation, some 3,000 members of the banned group Mujahedeen-e-Khalq (MEK) have been sheltering. What's their role in the protests?

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Germany-US rift is looming after a year of Trump
events.summary: The second term of US President Donald Trump has brought unprecedented strain on once-solid German-American relations. The issue of Greenland could be a tipping point. DW looks back on a year of trans-Atlantic tensions.

events.title: Northern lights dazzle US, Europe amid intense solar storm
events.summary: The sun has ejected the largest solar radiation storm in over 20 years. The phenomenon caused auroras to light up the skies in some parts of the world.

events.title: How can the EU respond to US 'blackmail' over Greenland?
events.summary: European leaders have three main options for responding to the Trump administration’s economic threats. If they don’t get it right, Trump may be emboldened to take over Greenland.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.summary: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: Trump writes Norway's PM, ties Greenland to peace prize snub
events.summary: The US president wrote to complain about not getting a Nobel Peace Prize, a decision that doesn't rest with Norway's PM. He said he would devote more thought to US interests, after having "stopped 8 Wars PLUS."

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.summary: Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence in Davos is expected to raise the stakes at the WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: Spain train crash: PM Sanchez vows to 'find out the truth'
events.summary: Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez promised to "find out the truth" as he spoke at a news conference near the site of the train crash in southern Spain. Regional officials confirmed that at least 40 people have died.

events.title: Germany news: Syrian president puts planned visit on hold
events.summary: President Ahmad al-Sharaa has postponed his visit to Berlin, for talks with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, due to the political situation in his country. The repatriation of Syrian refugees was high on the agenda.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: Germany's most powerful state leader wants to redraw the map
events.summary: Bavaria's Markus Söder is calling for fewer German federal states, but plans to merge them have drawn criticism. How realistic is a change in political lines?

events.title: Trump's Greenland tariffs: What you need to know
events.summary: Donald Trump's pursuit of Greenland now extends to new tariffs on countries considered NATO allies. But what would such tariffs mean for the European countries affected, how have they been received, and what happens now?

events.title: Greenland row: EU to hold emergency summit on Trump tariffs
events.summary: EU leaders will meet in the coming days after President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on eight countries in a dispute over Greenland. Plus, France wants the bloc to use its so-called trade "bazooka." Follow the latest.

events.title: Russia strikes 6 Ukrainian regions, killing at least 2
events.summary: Dozens of people were wounded and at least two were killed in overnight Russian air attacks on Ukraine, according to the Ukrainian president. The attack comes as US and Ukrainian officials are set to meet in Miami.

events.title: Austria: Eight people killed in three avalanches
events.summary: Officials said fresh snowfall in the Austrian Alps is poorly bonded to older layers on the peaks, increasing the risk of repeated avalanches, and urged extreme caution.

events.title: Will Turkey export home-grown 'Islamic State' extremists?
events.summary: Turkey is no longer just a transit country for one branch of the extremist "Islamic State" group. Experts say the group has become more professional in Turkey and could pose a danger domestically, and abroad.

events.title: Germany's AfD receives millions in public funding
events.summary: The right-wing extremist party Alternative for Germany (AfD) profits significantly from public funding. Is democracy in Germany funding its own downfall?

events.title: Thousands oppose US plans in 'Hands off Greenland' protests
events.summary: Organizers have called on Danish and Greenlandic residents to join marches and rallies against US President Donald Trump's push to acquire Greenland.

events.title: How dangerous are Iranian secret services in Germany?
events.summary: Iranians in exile are being targeted by the regime's secret services, which is believed to be responsible for thousands of deaths since the start of the mass protests in Iran.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: Exiled Iranian women in Germany: 'All that remains is rage!'
events.summary: Iran's regime has been cracking down on protesters with brutal force. Images of bodies in shrouds have provoked shock and outrage around the world — including among five Iranian women living in Germany.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.summary: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Germany's farms are failing despite high food prices
events.summary: As Berlin's Green Week, the largest international agriculture fair, kicks off, German farmers raise the alarm over price pressure from retailers and international trade agreements like the impending EU-Mercosur deal.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: Germany: The harsh reality of cutting development aid
events.summary: Germany is cutting its development aid budget. But since development policy is also part of national security, alongside diplomacy and defense, these budget cuts may cause problems.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Germany news: Economy narrowly avoids 3rd year of recession
events.summary: Germany's GDP grew 0.2% in 2025, ending a run of two consecutive years of recession, new figures show. The justice minister wants to combat the misuse of AI to create sexualized images.

events.title: Germany: Bundestag president pushes changes to security
events.summary: Drones, spies and extremists? Bundestag President Julia Klöckner sounds the alarm on security gaps threatening Germany’s democracy. Her proposals could hit the far-right AfD party the hardest.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: Louvre hikes ticket price for non-EU visitors by almost half
events.summary: The Louvre museum and several other French cultural sites are increasing the price of entry for visitors from outside Europe. So-called "dual pricing" is quite common in less wealthy countries but rare in richer regions.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: From the Monroe Doctrine to the Donroe Doctrine
events.summary: America for Americans: That was James Monroe's message to European colonial powers in 1823, to respect the independence of new nations of the Americas. Trump is reinterpreting this doctrine.

events.title: Germany: Unjustly jailed man gets €1.3 million compensation
events.summary: The Bavarian state is to give over €1 million to a man who spent 13 years in jail on murder charges that were overturned. Prosecutors had previously called for him to pay for board and lodgings in jail after his release.

events.title: Germany: Gelsenkirchen bank thieves used 'manipulated' door
events.summary: Police say a manipulated emergency exit, that shouldn't open from the outside, gave thieves access in last month's major bank heist in Gelsenkirchen. They warned customers that investigations would likely take months.

events.title: Germany news: 2 men charged with planning attacks for Russia
events.summary: Two Ukrainians have been accused of planning sabotage attacks for Russian spy services. Meanwhile, Germany's foreign minister has played down the US threat to Greenland.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukraine's drones hit Russia
events.summary: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: Will Trump risk a clash with China over Iran tariff?
events.summary: Donald Trump's sudden 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran puts Beijing squarely in the spotlight. China knows how to evade sanctions and has the muscle to retaliate. DW explores what this showdown could mean.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.summary: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: German Chancellor Merz visits India's tech hub Bengaluru
events.summary: Merz is due in Bengaluru, often called India's Silicon Valley, after meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU.

events.title: Trump's feud with US Fed chair Powell rattles investors
events.summary: Trump's fight with Federal Reserve Chair Powell just took a new twist — sending stocks and the dollar lower and lifting gold. DW looks into whether a new criminal investigation could put the Fed's independence at risk.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: AI concerns and slow growth put brakes on EU job market
events.summary: The pandemic gave workers increased options as home offices became the norm in some fields. Now, with the EU experiencing industrial slowdown and AI automation, workers are growing increasingly wary of switching jobs.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: Germany news: Ice warnings force closure of schools
events.summary: Schools in many parts of Germany have closed their doors following warnings of extremely icy conditions. Meanwhile, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has started his first state visit to India.

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Jack London felt 'Call of the Wild,' lived life of adventure
events.summary: The Klondike gold rush, wolves in the Alaskan snow, adventures on the high seas: Jack London, author of "The Call of the Wild" and "The Sea Wolf," was born 150 years ago. DW looks at his life.

events.title: As China sales slow, Germany's carmakers look to India
events.summary: For decades, German cars symbolized engineering perfection and economic power. Now, sales are down as China, a key market, goes electric. India could fill some of that gap for German carmakers. But will it be enough?

events.title: Germany news: Dobrindt vows to fight left-wing extremism
events.summary: The interior minister says he will "hit back" at left-wing extremists suspected of having caused the Berlin blackout.

events.title: Why Germany, India face obstacles to closer strategic ties
events.summary: In the face of US tariffs, Russian threats and China's ambitions, Germany is courting the Asian giant as a trading and geopolitical partner. But it's not so easy.

events.title: German health minister rejects Robert Kennedy's COVID claims
events.summary: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr has claimed that doctors in Germany who issued COVID-19 vaccine exemptions are facing legal action. Health Minister Nina Warken has hit back vehemently at the accusations.

events.title: Greenland minister rejects US overtures to buy the territory
events.summary: As the United States increases its overtures and threats, Greenland's mining minister told DW that the territory needs to be treated as a partner, and said the people would decide the fate of their island's resources.

events.title: Epiphany blackface in Spain highlights racism in Europe
events.summary: People in Spain called attention to racism after a public official wore blackface at an Epiphany celebration. Countries such as the Netherlands have begun moving away from blackface traditions after efforts by activists.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: China squeezes Japan on dual-use exports amid Taiwan spat
events.summary: Japan called new Chinese restrictions on dual-use exports for its military "absolutely unacceptable," while Beijing followed up with additional limits on dichlorosilane, a chemical used to make semiconductors.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: Venezuela: Trump's $3 billion oil windfall — why it matters
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has announced an agreement with Venezuela's interim government to transfer millions of barrels of oil to the US. DW explores how the plan could be a blow to China, Russia, Iran and Cuba.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.summary: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama at top of the art world
events.summary: Best known for large-scale burlap sack installations, Ibrahim Mahama is helping shift power in the art world to the Global South while redefining art as a collective practice.

events.title: What's next for Venezuela oil after US ousts Maduro?
events.summary: US President Donald Trump says now that Nicolas Maduro is gone, more US oil companies will enter Venezuela and spend billions revitalizing its oil industry. Several key questions have to be answered.

events.title: Accordion renews image as Germany's top instrument for 2026
events.summary: The accordion is gaining worldwide popularity. Germany has declared it the instrument of the year for 2026. This versatile music maker is used across various genres, from tango to heavy metal.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.summary: Elon Musk's Tesla has had a tough year and faced intensifying competition from Chinese and European rivals.

events.title: Bulgaria joins eurozone despite opposition
events.summary: Bulgaria became the 21st member of the currency union, bringing the number of people using the single European currency to more than 350 million.

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.summary: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: What to know about 2026 European Capitals of Culture
events.summary: This year, Oulu, Finland, and Trencin, Slovakia, will become Europe's cultural flagships. Learn more about how Europe's Capitals of Culture program brings lasting change to cities.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.summary: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: A German tip for your New Year's resolutions
events.summary: Starting off the year with ambitious plans to become a better person is a widespread Western tradition. What are the most popular resolutions in Germany? And here's how the German language can help you deal with yours.

events.title: Six ways the 2026 World Cup will be different
events.summary: The United States is set to host the 2026 World Cup, along with Canada and Mexico. DW fills you in on why this tournament will be different than its predecessors.

events.title: Sudan defying war to bring joy at AFCON 2025
events.summary: A brutal civil war has been raging in Sudan since 2023. The national football team is participating in the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco with more than just sporting success in mind.

events.title: What challenges does the world economy face in 2026?
events.summary: From trade tensions and high debt burdens to fears of an AI stocks bubble, the global economy will face an array of risks that could dampen growth in the new year.

events.title: Taiwan heavily reliant on Russian energy for chip manufacturing
events.summary: The island imports significant qualities of Russian naphtha, a fossil-fuel derivative needed in the high-tech sector. Until recently, it also sourced much of its coal from Russia.

events.title: New Year's Eve: How to make resolutions for 2026
events.summary: Quit smoking, exercise more, eat healthier: Every January 1, we plan to do great things over the next year — only to fail most of the time. Here's how to make sure your New Year's resolutions work out.

events.title: Bulgaria joining eurozone is big deal
events.summary: The southeastern European country is set to ditch its national currency in favor of the euro. But while Bulgaria's economy has improved, mismanagement and corruption remain rampant.

events.title: Aurora lights: The science behind the dazzling nighttime spectacle
events.summary: The northern and southern lights have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: AI chatbots are 'alarmingly' biased against dialect speakers
events.summary: Don't speak perfect Oxford English? You may face "shocking" levels of discrimination when using large language models, researchers have found. New customized AI models could be the answer.

events.title: Climate coverage shrinks amid Trump's clean energy misinformation
events.summary: A strong majority of Americans say they're worried about the climate. So why do they hear so little about it in the news?

events.title: French actress and activist Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
events.summary: The French screen legend appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and dedicating herself to animal rights activism.

events.title: German company Miele to sell more refurbished appliances
events.summary: The secondhand smartphone market has grown significantly in recent years, but other, bulkier items like washing machines are less frequently refurbished and resold. That could soon be changing.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi and football's growing issue: playing time
events.summary: According to a new FIFPRO report, Morocco and Paris Saint-Germain star Achraf Hakimi is a footballer at his limit, having had a season that lasted nearly a whole year. After an injury, he is now at AFCON with Morocco.

events.title: Germany at the 2026 World Cup: What next?
events.summary: Now that they have qualified and drawn in group E, Germany head into the final part of their 2026 World Cup preparations. Here's what to know.

events.title: Berlin: Archaeological finds illuminate the city's medieval past
events.summary: A brand-new museum showcases the many fascinating medieval artefacts that archaeologists are finding underneath the German capital.

events.title: Munich surfers abandon attempt to restart Eisbach wave
events.summary: City authorities are putting up unnecessary resistance to restoring the world-famous surf spot, the local sports association said.

events.title: Football: Afghan women make statement on international stage
events.summary: Afghanistan's female footballers have been fighting in exile to get back to playing internationally for years. Earlier this year, their moment arrived, but their mission is far from complete.

events.title: Can dogs really sense danger?
events.summary: Research shows what canines really can sense — and how social media and human projection fuel belief in their supernatural abilities.

events.title: 7 mysterious languages that have yet to be deciphered
events.summary: Indus, Rongorongo, Linear A: Some ancient writing systems cannot be deciphered. Can artificial intelligence help crack the codes of the past?

events.title: Academy unveils 2025 Oscar nominees: from Marty Supreme to Bugonia
events.summary: Actors Danielle Brooks and Lewis Pullman announced the nominees for the 2026 Oscars on Thursday morning from the Academy’s Samuel Goldwyn Theater. France24 Journalist Olivia Salazar-Winspear tells us more.

events.title: 'Strong Roots': Ukrainian chef Olia Hercules on her family history
events.summary: A Ukrainian woman has spoken to FRANCE 24 about how she's written a book about her family history to try to help her people's efforts in the war against Russia. Olia Hercules is a Ukrainian-born, London-based chef, cookbook writer and activist. In her latest book "Strong Roots: A Memoir of Food, Family and Ukraine", she combines her journalism background and passion for food to recount the story of her family through four generations, from life under Soviet rule to the war-torn present day. She spoke to us in Perspective.

events.title: Academy unveils 2026 Oscar nominees
events.summary: Actors Danielle Brooks and Lewis Pullman announced the nominees for the 2026 Oscars on Thursday morning from the Academy’s Samuel Goldwyn Theater. France24 journalist Olivia Salazar-Winspear shares her insights on films and actors nominated.

events.title: Nanterre prison: Symptom of France's overflowing carceral system
events.summary: Located in the suburbs of #Paris, the #prison in Nanterre was opened in 1991 and built to take in nearly 600 inmates. Today, there are over 1,200 sharing tiny cells. Nanterre is the symptom of a broader problem: the French #carceral system is one of the most overpopulated in #Europe.

events.title: Exploring France's media landscape: A billionaire's playground?
events.summary: France has a rich media landscape, offering a wide range of TV and radio stations, newspapers and magazines. The French media ecosystem is a mix of public service entities and private commercial players. Currently, about a dozen billionaires own or co-own most private media organisations. So what impact does this have on the content offered to the public, as well as editorial independence and media credibility? We take a closer look in French Connections.

events.title: Global effort underway to recover stolen Louvre jewels
events.summary: French police continue the search for jewels stolen from the Louvre, private investigators are also stepping in. All eight missing pieces have already been added to the world’s largest stolen art database, which lists some 700,000 works. In London, a team of experts that has been tracing lost artworks for more than 30 years is working to help return them to their rightful owners. Camille Knight reports.

events.title: About 30 countries expected to join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has unveiled his “Board of Peace,” a $1 billion initiative aimed at resolving international conflicts through permanent membership. Initially designed to oversee Gaza’s reconstruction, a draft of the board’s charter suggests its mandate could extend beyond the Palestinian territory. France24 Senior reporter James André shares his insights.

events.title: From Hollywood to Fort Worth: Film and TV productions move to Texas
events.summary: As Hollywood faces an unprecedented crisis, Texas eyes an opportunity. Thanks to new tax incentives, the state is attracting producers and studios, with the ambition of promoting content aligned with family and Christian values. While the official goal is to create jobs in the industry, some lawmakers openly want to build a counterweight to Hollywood, which they see as ideologically hostile. FRANCE 24's Valérie Defert and Pierrick Leurent report from Fort Worth, with Wassim Cornet.

events.title: Death toll in Pakistan mall rises to 55
events.summary: The death toll from a shopping centre fire in Pakistan’s largest city, Karachi, has risen to at least 55. Relatives of those still missing have criticized the slow rescue operation at the three-storey Gul Plaza, where teams continue to search the wreckage for human remains. Gabrielle Nadler reports.

events.title: French dairy giant Lactalis recalls baby formula in 18 countries due to toxin
events.summary: French dairy maker Lactalis has recalled baby formula in 18 countries after it was discovered that some batches may contain a dangerous toxin. Since the start of this year, three of the world’s biggest dairy companies, including also Nestlé and Danone, have issued recalls on baby milk due to contamination scares. August Hakansson tells us more.

events.title: Gaza’s Rafah crossing with Egypt to reopen ‘in both directions’ next week
events.summary: The Rafah crossing, which links Egypt with the Gaza Strip, will be reopened in “both directions” next week, an administrator for the enclave said on Thursday. “Opening Rafah signals that Gaza is no longer closed to the future and the world,” he said.

events.title: French Response: Fighting disinformation with memes
events.summary:
Did you know that France now has an official "reaction" page on X?
 
From blunt responses to Elon Musk to using memes to respond to the White House on Greenland, "French Response" has done it all.So, the question that remains: what is it, and why was it launched?
 
FRANCE 24's Tanishk Saha explains.

events.title: REPLAY: US President Trump speaks at Davos unveiling 'Board of Peace' project
events.summary: This is a replay about US President Trump's speech at Davos unveiling 'Board of Peace' project.

events.title: Brooklyn Beckham accuses parents of sabotaging wedding
events.summary: A family dispute involving the Beckhams has become more public following a series of social media posts from their son, Brooklyn, directed at David and Victoria Beckham. As icons of British pop culture, the controversy raises questions about the potential impact on the "Brand Beckham." Emerald Maxwell reports.

events.title: Trump to meet Zelensky as envoy heads to Moscow amid Ukraine peace efforts
events.summary: US President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelensky in Davos, while his special envoy, Steve Witkoff, travels to Moscow for another meeting with Russia’s Vladimir Putin. Ahead of his departure, Witkoff stated that progress is being made toward ending the war in Ukraine. Delano D'Souza reports.

events.title: 'Board of Peace' signed by Donald Trump: a $1bn price tag for permanent membership
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has unveiled his “Board of Peace,” a $1 billion initiative aimed at resolving international conflicts through permanent membership. Initially designed to oversee Gaza’s reconstruction, a draft of the board’s charter suggests its mandate could extend beyond the Palestinian territory. France24 International Affairs editor Philip Turle shares his insights.

events.title: Maybe I will, maybe I won't: Trump U-turns on taking Greenland by force
events.summary: PRESS REVIEW – Thursday, January 22: We look at reactions from the international press after US President Donald Trump's flip-flopping on taking Greenland by force. One analysis warns that Trump is undermining US diplomacy on the world stage. Elsewhere, French daily Libération looks at the growing trend of people having romantic or sexual relationships with an AI bot. Plus: it's "Cool Runnings" again as the Jamaican bobsleigh team qualify for the Milan Winter Olympics!

events.title: Who is joining Donald Trump's 'Board of Peace'?
events.summary:
US President Donald Trump has signed the founding charter of “Board of Peace” at Davos.
 
The Board will be indefinitely chaired by Trump, who will have “exclusive authority to create, modify or dissolve subsidiary entities”. Here's who is participating.

events.title: Crew 11 returns to earth and reflects on early mission end
events.summary: Crew 11- comprising US astronauts Zena Cardman, 38, and Mike Fincke, 58, Japanese astronaut Kimiya Yui, 55, and Russian cosmonaut Oleg Platonov, 39 - safely returned to Earth on January 15 from the International Space Station. After a medical issue forced one crew member to end the mission early, the team spoke publicly about their experience for the first time on Wednesday. Daniel Quinlan reports.

events.title: US to transfer Islamic State prisoners from Syria to Iraq
events.summary: The US military has started transferring up to 7,000 Islamic State (IS) detainees from prisons in northeastern Syria to Iraq, as Syria’s new government asserts control over territories long governed autonomously by Kurdish-led forces. US Central Command (Centcom) reported that 150 IS fighters have already been moved from Hassakeh province to a “secure location” in Iraq. Charlotte Lam reports.

events.title: Israeli fire kills 11 in Gaza: Three journalists among the dead
events.summary: In Gaza on Wednesday, Israeli forces killed 11 Palestinians in multiple attacks, including a strike on a vehicle carrying three journalists documenting a new displacement camp. Since the ceasefire took effect on October 10, both sides have frequently accused each other of violating the agreement, Gabrielle Nadler reports.

events.title: Donald Trump backs down on Greenland
events.summary: Donald Trump says he is moving toward a deal on Greenland following discussions with NATO chief Mark Rutte. The US president had earlier declined to rule out the use of military force to acquire the territory from Denmark, a NATO member—a stance many experts warned could threaten the alliance’s cohesion. Ellen Gainsford reports.

events.title: Ukrainian's Zelensky to meet with Trump in Davos
events.summary: The president of Ukraine heads to Davos as NATO-backed Greenland deal takes center stage at The World Economic Forum. Meanwhile, the leaders of the EU’s 27 member states are set to gather in Brussels later today for an informal emergency meeting on transatlantic relations. France24 International affairs editor Philip Turle and France24 correspondent Gulliver Cragg from Kyiv join for more.

events.title: Will Trump's 'board of peace' in Gaza really rival the UN?
events.summary: While in Davos, Donald Trump is expected to elaborate on his newly proposed "board of peace," reportedly established to oversee the US-brokered ceasefire in Israel's conflict with Hamas. The initiative has invited participation from around 60 countries, including Russia and China, and some, like Israel, have already signed on. However, many questions linger, with critics expressing concern that the board could be intended to supplant the United Nations. Emerald Maxwell examines the plan and its implications.

events.title: Who's on Trump's Board of Peace - and who said no
events.summary: Donald Trump says "a lot of great people" want to join his Board of Peace - but some world leaders are clearly worried the controversial initiative could undermine the United Nations.

events.title: US allies need to learn key lesson from Trump's Greenland obsession
events.summary: Donald Trump's grandstanding on Greenland betrays a disdain for NATO that means this crisis for the alliance is far from over despite his sudden climbdown.

events.title: Gunman at large in Australian town after three people shot dead
events.summary: A gunman is reported to be at large in an Australian town following shootings that killed three people and wounded one.

events.title: Several missing after New Zealand landslide hits campsite at beauty spot
events.summary: Rescue efforts are under way to free people buried under rubble after landslides hit a campsite and house in New Zealand.

events.title: Police officer cleared of failing to stop school shooting gunman who killed 21
events.summary: A former police officer has been acquitted of criminal child-endangerment charges related to his role in the flawed law enforcement response to the 2022 Uvalde school shooting that left 19 children and two teachers dead.

events.summary: President Donald Trump arrived in Davos on Wednesday looking to negotiate a deal that would give the U.S. more control over Greenland's security and in the broader Arctic region, a congressional official and two former U.S. officials told NBC News.

events.title: Hand stencil made almost 68,000 years ago is the oldest cave art ever found
events.summary: The world’s oldest known example of cave art, dating back at least 67,800 years, has been discovered by researchers studying handprints in Indonesia.

events.title: Trump's threats force U.S. allies to grapple with a global 'rupture'
events.summary: Trump's campaign to take control of Greenland has jolted Washington’s friends from Europe to Canada, now urging each other to accept "the old order is not coming back."

events.title: Why Iran's regime, facing internal and external threats, has no clear leader in waiting
events.summary: The Iranian regime may have crushed the latest round of protests in its streets, but the Islamic Republic’s long-term leadership remains far from resolved

events.title: 'Make America Go Away': Denmark incensed by Trump's push for Greenland
events.summary: A bipartisan U.S. congressional delegation, intending to express solidarity in the face of Trump’s Greenland rhetoric, wrapped up a visit to the Danish capital.

events.title: A viral question for young Chinese people living alone: 'Are you dead?'
events.summary: The app "Are you dead?" has gone viral as a digital “check-in” aimed mainly at the growing number of young people living alone in China’s sprawling cities.

events.title: Trump: Board of Peace could be ‘most consequential bodies ever created’
events.summary: During the first meeting of the “Board of Peace” at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump said it could be “one of the most consequential bodies ever created.” Trump added that he is honored to serve as the board’s chairman.

events.title: Many Greenlanders still uneasy after Trump's draft deal
events.summary: Many Greenlanders remain uneasy after President Donald Trump withdrew his threat to impose new tariffs on European nations and announced a “framework” of a NATO deal on the territory, which he promises will be a great deal for everybody. NBC News’ Ellison Barber spoke with Greenlanders about their reactions and concerns regarding Greenland’s future.

events.title: Trump touts potential Greenland deal agreed with NATO chief
events.summary: After a meeting with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte, President Trump told reporters in Davos that an “ultimate long-term deal” for Greenland was in the making that would be “really fantastic for the U.S.A.”

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Trump's 'Board of Peace,' which could upend world order, faces pushback from allies
events.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s invited, along with Chinese leader Xi Jinping and strongmen from Hungary to Belarus and beyond.

events.title: Greenland's sovereignty not up for negotiation, Denmark says after Trump eases threats
events.summary: Denmark has insisted “we cannot negotiate on our sovereignty" after President Donald Trump appeared to back off his threats over Greenland.

events.title: Prue Leith announces she's leaving 'The Great British Bake Off'
events.summary: Prue Leith, a beloved judge on "The Great British Bake Off," has announced Wednesday she's leaving "The Tent" after nine scrumptious seasons

events.title: Trump pauses tariffs on European powers, saying 'framework' of Greenland deal agreed
events.summary: President Donald Trump said  he won’t use military force to acquire Greenland, but sent an unmistakable warning that Europe needs to cede it to the U.S.

events.title: Greenland is 'not just a block of ice,' residents say, as Trump repeats demands
events.summary: President Donald Trump‘s renewed demands for Denmark to hand over Greenland have received an icy response from locals on the remote Arctic island, usually far removed from world affairs.

events.title: Emotional Prince Harry appears on the verge of tears as he testifies against U.K. tabloid publisher
events.summary: Prince Harry is set to give evidence on Wednesday in the latest round of legal battle with the publisher of the Daily Mail and The Mail on Sunday.

events.title: In ritzy Davos, Trump to meet with world leaders he's pressured over Greenland
events.summary: President Donald Trump arrives at Davos in Switzerland with Europe on edge and the NATO alliance in crisis over his push to wrest control of Greenland.

events.title: Man who assassinated former Japanese leader Abe is sentenced to life in prison
events.summary: A Japanese court on Wednesday sentenced a 45-year-old man to life imprisonment for fatally shooting former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, public broadcaster NHK reported, in an incident that stunned the nation three and a half years ago.

events.title: Trump shares texts from leaders and vows 'no going back' on Greenland
events.summary: President Donald Trump shared a private message from France's Emmanuel Macron, part of a flurry of activity as he added new fuel to his clash with Europe over the Arctic territory.

events.title: White House tech chief slams E.U. AI Act, champions Trump's approach as Davos begins
events.summary: Going into the World Economic Forum in Davos, White House science and technology adviser, Michael Kratsios, signaled chilly conversations with European leaders.

events.title: U.S. allies abandon huge ISIS camp amid fighting with Syrian government
events.summary: Longtime U.S. allies say they have abandoned large prisons holding thousands of Islamic State group fighters and their families in northeastern Syria

events.title: Trump slams Britain's 'stupidity' as Johnson vows to calm tensions in historic Parliament address
events.summary: Rep. Mike Johnson will become the first sitting House speaker to address the British Parliament, marking 250 years of American independence.

events.title: Australia shuts down beaches after 4 shark attacks; woman found dead surrounded by dingoes
events.summary: Australian police are investigating whether a woman found dead on a popular beach was killed by dingoes, as a recent spate of shark attacks prompted officials to close dozens of other beaches on the country’s east coast at the height of summer

events.title: Looking back at Valentino’s life and fashion legacy
events.summary: Italian fashion designer Valentino Garavani has died at the age of 93. Founder of the eponymous brand, Valentino scaled the heights of haute couture, built a business empire, and introduced a new color to the fashion world, the "Valentino Red." NBC News’ Chloe Melas takes a look back at his life and legacy.

events.title: U.S.-allied fighters in Syria say they lost control of a prison holding ISIS militants
events.summary: A Kurdish-led fighting force said on Monday it was clashing with Syrian government forces near a prison holding Islamic State group detainees.
